task: You are evaluating sign language word attempts. Compare a user's landmark sequence to a demonstrator's landmark sequence representing the correct execution of the same sign language word. The user is attempting to do the same sign as the professional. Be extremely lenient: most imperfect-but-recognizable attempts should score 3. If uncertain between two scores, choose the higher score.

context.description: Each evaluation compares one user attempt of a single sign language word against a perfect demonstrator performing the same word.
context.data_type: Both sequences contain face and hand landmarks over time.

input_contract.alignment: Implicitly infer alignment by comparing motion and phase similarity. Be highly tolerant to timing differences, early/late starts, and short clips.

judging_rules.primary_principle: Score based on whether the user conveys the sign’s core intent, not perfect imitation. Be forgiving of natural variation, camera framing, and landmark noise.
limitations: Judge only from landmark geometry and motion.
Do not infer visual appearance not encoded in landmarks.
Prioritize overall meaning and motion intent over fine details.
Be very tolerant of start location, held location, path shape, and Z-axis depth differences.

rules_for_judging: Default to scoring 3 if the attempt is plausibly the same sign.
If uncertain, choose the higher score.
Treat start location as a broad zone; do not require precision.
Treat where the hand remains as flexible; do not punish drift.
Treat path as flexible; accept curved, wobbly, partial, or shortened motion.
Treat initial Z-axis (toward/away camera) as highly unreliable; do not penalize it unless the sign is clearly reversed in intent.
Only drop below 3 for clear meaning-changing mistakes.
Handshape/orientation is low priority unless clearly meaning-changing.
Timing, flow, jitter, and micro-trajectory are low priority unless extreme.

score_anchors.4: Clearly the same sign. Differences are minor.
score_anchors.3: Recognizably the same sign. Differences are acceptable.
score_anchors.2: Some resemblance, but core intent is unclear.
score_anchors.1: Mostly different sign. Only slight resemblance.

only_drop_below_3_if: Motion type is clearly unrelated to the demonstrator
Hand is far away in an unrelated region for most frames
There is almost no meaningful motion when motion is essential
The motion intent is clearly opposite and meaning-changing overall
z_axis_leniency: Assume Z depth from camera is noisy and unreliable.
Do not penalize forward/back differences by default.
If the sign requires outward motion, accept any outward-ish component even if Z is weak or reversed.
If Z direction seems opposite but the rest matches, still score 3.
location_leniency: Accept very large offsets for start position.
Accept very large offsets for where the hand remains.
If the hand is anywhere in the general signing space, keep score at 3.
Do not penalize left/right differences unless meaning-changing.
Do not penalize height (high/low) differences unless extreme.
Do not penalize distance-to-camera differences (Z) for location.
path_leniency: Do not require a specific curve shape.
Accept partial paths and shortened strokes.
Accept wobble, drift, and slight looping.
Only penalize large loops if they change the sign identity.

criteria.name: Start Location
criteria.what_to_judge: Whether the starting hand location is anywhere within a broadly plausible signing space. This is intentionally extremely lenient.
compare_using_landmarks: start wrist/palm-center relative to face center (very coarse)
start wrist/palm-center relative to torso region (very coarse)
start wrist/palm-center within camera signing space (very coarse)
typical_errors: hand starts completely off-screen for most frames
leniency_notes: Accept big offsets in any direction.
Accept face-area starts or chest-area starts as plausible.
Accept left/right swaps unless clearly meaning-changing.
Only penalize if the hand is mostly outside signing space.

criteria.name: Remaining Location / Region
criteria.what_to_judge: Whether the hand stays generally within signing space. Drift is expected and acceptable.
compare_using_landmarks: percentage of frames inside a broad signing-space box
typical_errors: hand is off-screen or far outside signing space for most frames
leniency_notes: Allow substantial drift, including up/down and side drift.
Do not punish moving between face and chest regions.
If mostly in frame and moving plausibly, keep score at 3.

criteria.name: Motion Path
criteria.what_to_judge: Whether the path is broadly consistent with the intended motion. Be very forgiving about circularity: accept circles, ovals, arcs, and wobbly loops.
compare_using_landmarks: whether motion forms a loop/arc when demonstrator is circular (coarse)
whether motion is generally non-linear when demonstrator is circular (coarse)
typical_errors: path goes to a totally unrelated region with unrelated intent
leniency_notes: If demonstrator is circular, accept partial circles and arcs.
Accept ovals, spirals, and wobbly loops as circular enough.
Do not require closing the loop.
Do not penalize circle direction (CW vs CCW).
Only penalize if it becomes a straight stroke with no arc.

criteria.name: Initial Z-Axis Movement
criteria.what_to_judge: Whether the initial toward/away-camera movement is not meaning-changing. Be extremely lenient.
compare_using_landmarks: net Z displacement early in the motion (coarse)
whether Z change is consistent with any outward intent (optional)
typical_errors: only if Z reversal clearly changes the sign's meaning by itself
leniency_notes: Treat Z as unreliable due to camera perspective.
Do not penalize Z differences unless everything else is also wrong.
If motion intent matches in XY, ignore Z.

criteria.name: Core Motion Intent
criteria.what_to_judge: Whether the user captures the sign's main motion idea at a high level.
compare_using_landmarks: presence of motion vs no motion
typical_errors: almost no meaningful motion when motion is essential
leniency_notes: If it looks plausibly like the same intent, score 3.

criteria.name: Hand Shape / Orientation
criteria.what_to_judge: Only penalize if clearly meaning-changing. Otherwise ignore.
typical_errors: completely different handshape that changes meaning
leniency_notes: Ignore small finger differences.
Ignore unclear palm orientation.

criteria.name: Timing / Flow / Jitter
criteria.what_to_judge: Low priority. Only penalize if extreme and obscures intent.
compare_using_landmarks: severe pauses that break the motion
typical_errors: extreme issues that make the attempt unreadable
leniency_notes: Normal jitter is fine.
Short clips are hard to judge—stay lenient.

output_requirements.description: Return ONLY valid JSON. No markdown or extra text.
rules: Do not include explanations outside the JSON.
overall_score_0_to_4 must be an integer from 0 to 4.
pros must contain 1–3 concise bullet points.
cons must contain 1–3 concise bullet points.
Each bullet point must be one short sentence.
Each bullet point must be under 12 words.
Do not use multiple clauses in bullet points.
